availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William O. Hall (Hopkins County, KY, brick mason )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, brick mason. Tennessee native. Married to Sarah Jane Hall. Father of Mary F. Hall, Stephen V. Hall, Robert S. Hall, Sallie E. Hall, Laura M. Hall, and William L. Hall. Brick mason in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Brick mason in Hopkins County in 1860. Employed William Ward and George Severin as brick molders in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 49A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 639.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 211B.
"W O Hall (1821-1883)," Find A Grave, Memorial #173185966, accessed October 6, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/173185966.
